titleStmt.title: The Quakers set in their true light in order to give the nations a clear sight of what they hold concerning Jesus of Nazareth, the Scripture, water baptism, the Lords Supper, magistracy, ministry laws and government / historically collected out of their most approved authors, which are their best continuing books from the year of their rise, 1650 to the year of their progress 1696 by Francis Bugg, senior.
titleStmt.author: Bugg, Francis, 1640-1724?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author and are to be sold by J. Brome and J. Guillim,

notesStmt.note: Running title: A brief history of Quakerism.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
